bibl.title: Letter from the Designing Engineer of the Alabama Power Company to Henry Rose Carter, January 20, 1915

div1.p: The Designing Engineer reports that he has been unable to obtain samples of fish from local ponds.

div1.head: Letter from the Designing Engineer of the Alabama Power Company to Henry Rose Carter, January 20, 1915
div1.opener:
FRANK S. WASHBURN,
PRESIDENT
J. W. WORTHINGTON, VICE-PRESIDENT.
F. M. CHAMBERLAIN, GENL. MGR.
THOS. W. MARTIN, GEN. COUNSEL.
WILEY ALFORD, SEC'Y & TREAS.
ALABAMA POWER COMPANY
BIRMINGHAM, ALABAMA.
January 20th, 1915.
Dr. H. R. Carter,
U.S. Public Health Service,
Baltimore, Md.
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
Your letter of the 8th has remained unanswered
until this time for the reason that I have been so busy
on other matters that I have been unable to investigate
the proposition of obtaining top minnows from the Shrader
Mill Pond, which is at the head waters of the Waxahatchee
Creek.

Yesterday, together with another man, I spent
two hours on the shores of this pond and the creek above
and below in an attempt to gather some specimens for the
purpose of identification. During this time we saw but
one minnow and we were unable to catch it.

I gathered from the description which Mr. LePrince
gave that this pond is well stocked with minnows during
mosquito season, and I presume that the reason we had no
better luck is because these fish are feeding on the bottom
rather than on the top at this time. I had only a dip net
to catch them in, and before I went I had the impression
I would have no difficulty in gathering such specimens as
I would need; however, I now believe that if we are to
gather any specimens either for identification or for the
purpose of breeding, it would be necessary to set some type
of fish trap on the bottom of the pond properly baited or
else to drag the pond with a close mesh screen.

The main thought which occurs to me, however,
after having had this experience is that we are not making
any mistake in looking elsewhere for other varieties of
minnows and experimenting with them, as well as with the
local varieties.

Should these minnows increase in numbers during
the coming months, we can, of course, gather them by means
of seine and stock the reservoir with them, but if the num-
FRANK S. WASHBURN,
PRESIDENT
J. W. WORTHINGTON, VICE-PRESIDENT.
F. M. CHAMBERLAIN, GENL. MGR.
THOS. W. MARTIN, GEN. COUNSEL.
WILEY ALFORD, SEC'Y & TREAS.
ALABAMA POWER COMPANY
BIRMINGHAM, ALABAMA.
#2 H.R.C. 1/20/1915/
bers should remain as they were yesterday it looks as though
the stocking of the reservoir from this pond would be al-
most an impossible proposition.

I was very interested in the extracts from Mr.
LePrince's letter to you which you sent me. I think that
he is quite correct concerning the importance which the
top minnows will play in the mosquito control in our reser-
voir. Something that occurs to me right at this point is
that I examined the Shrader Mill Pond, which is about
fifty years old, for floating debris and I found that
floating pine needles were in great abundance, together
with leaves and twigs, pieces of bark, etc.

In this back woods country where our Lock 12
reservoir is located, I believe that it will always be
impossible to keep the surface free from similar material.

Mr. Van Dine, of the Bureau of Entomology, is
hoping to visit us during the early part of February and
help us select a breeding spot for the establishment of
a hatchery for such minnows as we will start to breed.

I am writing to Mr. LePrince to get his ideas
about the minnows from Shrader's Pond.

Next week we will begin to put all the people in
our Lock 12 camp who are carriers of malaria through an
eight weeks treatment of quinine. We are very anxious to
go through the coming season without having a single case
of malaria in our Lock 12 camp, and we are expecting to take
every measure to obtain this result.

Col. Mitchell was recently in the office and he
read your letter & pamphlet with great interest, and sends
his kindest regards to you.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, ALABAMA POWER COMPANY
Am
DESIGNING ENGINEER. OGT:LF
